Dear DOUGLAS DERSCHEID:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/14/23, there was a youth refusing to come out of the facility
bathroom. Staff member was antagonizing youth and pushed
youth once they came out of the bathroom. Pushing continued
between youth and staff member.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/17/2023. Administrator was aware of the incident and reported
he did review the video camera footage. Administrator reported
Staff 1 did push Youth A back to get Youth A out of his space.
Staff 1 pushed Youth A back twice, on one of the pushes Youth A
lost his footing and stumbled backwards. Administrator reported
Youth A is larger in size than Staff 1. Youth A has a pattern of
getting in staff’s space and using his size to intimidate staff as well
as being assaultive. Staff 1 was sitting in Youth A’s bedroom door
to prevent Youth A from barricading himself as Youth A has a
history of barricading himself in rooms.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/17/2023. Youth A reported another youth was having issues in
the house and he and Youth B were in their bedroom. Youth A
asked to use the bathroom. Staff 1 was sitting in Youth A and
Youth B’s bedroom doorway. Youth A asked Staff 1 to move so
he could use the bathroom. Staff 1 did not move. Youth A
attempted to move Staff 1’s chair. Staff 1 stood up and pushed
Youth A. Youth A reported he pushed Staff 1 back. Staff 1
pushed Youth A again. Youth A threatened to punch Staff 1.
Youth A fell to the ground from Staff 1 pushing him. Youth A did
not have any injuries. Youth A reported he used the bathroom
and went back to his room. Staff 1 pushed Youth A again. Youth
A reported Staff 1 pushed him a total of three times. Youth A
described Staff 1 pushing him by placing both of his hands on
Youth A’s chest twice and the other push by pushing his forearm.
Youth A reported Youth B was the only person who witnessed the
incident. Youth A reported this is the first time he has been
pushed by staff. Youth A reported a separate incident regarding a
dab pen (This is being investigated in SI 2023C0000470).
2

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/17/2023. Youth B reported on 5/15/2023 he was in his bedroom
with Youth A. There were some incidents occurring within the
house. Youth A asked to use the bathroom and he was informed
he could. Staff 1 was sitting in Youth A and Youth B’s doorway as
Youth A and Youth B were coming to their door to watch what was
happening with another youth down the hallway. Youth A asked
Staff 1 to move from the doorway so he could leave his bedroom
to use the bathroom. Staff 1 stood up from sitting in a chair in the
bedroom doorway and pushed Youth A backwards. Youth A
pushed Staff 1 back. Staff 1 pushed Youth A again causing Youth
A to fall to the ground. Youth B reported this was the first time this
has happened.
Staff 1 was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 5/26/2023. Staff
1 reported Youth A and Youth B were in their bedroom attempting
to antagonize a peer who was having some issues down the hall.
Staff 1 got a chair to sit in Youth A and Youth B’s doorway to keep
them from antagonizing the peer. Youth A and Youth B were
looking out the doorway to see what was going on down the hall.
Youth A pushed Staff 1 while trying to look out the door causing
Staff 1 to fall back into the chair. Youth A continued to get closer
to Staff 1 in the doorway and shoved Staff 1 again. Staff 1
reported he pushed Youth A back with one hand to create space
between him and Youth A. Staff 1 reported when he pushed
Youth A back, Youth A fell to the ground. Youth A got up and got
in Staff 1’s face and was swearing and threatened to hit Staff 1.
Staff 1 ignored Youth A’s behavior and threats. Administrator
arrived at this time and took Youth A to the bathroom. Staff 1
gave Youth A space after Youth A returned from the bathroom.
Staff 1 did not recall if Youth A was deescalated after returning
from the bathroom. Staff 1 reported he pushed Youth A one time.
Youth A pushed Staff 1 approximately five times during the
incident with one of the pushes resulting in Staff 1 falling to the
floor. Staff 1 reported this was the first time a situation like this
has occurred. Staff 1 reported the Safe Crisis Management
(SCM) model trains staff to give youth space when youth are
getting in staff’s boundaries. Staff 1 reported pushing Youth A
was not a trained SCM technique. Staff 1 reported he pushed
Youth A to create space. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not have
any injuries from the push resulting in Youth A falling to the
ground. Staff 1 reported Youth B was the only witness who saw
the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/17/2023. Staff 2 was working on 5/15/2023. Staff 2 was
3

downstairs with another youth when he heard noise upstairs.
Staff 2 went upstairs. Youth A told Staff 2 that he was pushed by
Staff 1. Staff 2 did not see the incident occur. Youth A did not
report any injuries to him. Staff 2 reported Youth B was the only
youth that would have witnessed the incident.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 5/17/2023 and
reported no further information.
Video Reviewed:
Two video footage clips of 5/15/2023, upstairs in Wilcox house
were reviewed on 5/17/2023. The video footage did not have any
sound.
Video one: Youth A comes to the doorway and leans out the door
to look down the hall. The angle of the video camera only allows
the top half of the doorway to be seen. An arm can be seen
pushing Youth A back and Youth A steps back in the inside of the
bedroom door. The back of Staff 1’s head appears on video and
he is standing in the doorway in front of Youth A. Youth A
continues to try to look out the door. Youth A and Staff 1’s arms
touch and Youth A pulls his arm back quickly and steps back
inside the door. Youth A steps back toward Staff 1 and pushes
his chest out to Staff 1. Youth A continues moving his body into
Staff 1 and nudges Staff 1, Staff 1 nudges Youth A back with his
right shoulder. Youth A pushes Staff 1. Staff 1 can not been seen
in the video. Staff 1 then is seen back in the doorway. Youth A
moves in to look around Staff 1 to see down the hallway. Staff 1
maintains standing in the doorway. Youth A then walks away from
the door.
Video two:
Youth A is standing in the doorway and leans out to look down the
hall. Staff 1 appears in the doorway and uses his right forearm to
push Youth A back into the bedroom. Youth A comes back into
the doorway and Staff 1 is using his body to block Youth A from
looking out the door. Staff 1 pushes Youth A back with two hands
near Youth A’s upper chest/shoulder area. Youth A pushes Staff
1 back. Youth A walks toward Staff 1 and Staff 1 pushes Youth A
back again with two hands and Youth A falls back to the ground.
Youth A gets up and walks toward Staff 1 and pushes Staff 1.
Staff 1’s arms go into the air, Youth A pushes Staff 1 again. Staff
1 continues standing in the doorway. Youth A appears to be
talking as his mouth can be seen moving on the video. Youth A
continues standing in the bedroom talking to Staff 1 and pushes
Staff 1 again. Youth A continues talking and Staff 2 appears on
the video and is talking to Youth A. Staff 2 steps into the bedroom
and is between Youth A and Staff 1.
4

Documents Reviewed:
• Pineview Homes Discipline Policy signed by Staff 1, dated
2/26/2020: “Pineview Homes prohibits all cruel and severe
discipline including: Any type of corporal punishment
inflicted in any manner.”
• Safe Crisis Management Manual: Pivot Parry/ Evasion
Deflection: “Pivot is a technique in which staff moves out of
harm’s way through a defensive maneuver. Perry is the
arm motion that coincides with the pivot to deflect a punch.”
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Safe Crisis
Management Recertification Training on 2/21/2023 and
2/22/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as during interviews with
staff, youth, and review of video footage, it was determined Staff 1
pushed Youth A three times and one resulting in Youth A falling to
the ground.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2022C0116039 dated 8/25/2022, CAP Approved 9/7/2022.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
